name: Adamantine
description: This alloy of electrum and adamant, a crystalline metal found in meteorites, is extraordinarily hard and durable. Armor of adamantine can protect against nearly anything, and weapons of adamantine never lose their sharpness.

armor.description: The armor causes critical hits against its wearer to become normal hits.

weapons.description: The weapon deals double damage against objects and structures and is considered magical when used to attack constructs.

name: Alchemical Silver
description: Mundane silver is good for jewelery making. An alchemist or cleric can treat silver in a special ritual to convert it to alchemical silver, a metal with benefits against undead, shapechangers, and other creatures of the night.

weapons.description: The weapon is considered magical when used to attack fiends, shapechangers, or undead.

name: Cold Iron
description: This variety of iron is found deep within the Underdark. When worked properly, it can be forged at a very low temperature. Cold iron is prized for its benefits against various types of fey creatures.

weapons.description: The weapon is considered magical when used to attack fey.

name: Dragonsteel
description: This form of steel is forged making use of a the breath weapon of a bound or willing dragon, imbuing it with elemental properties.

armor.description: The armor grants resistance to the breath weapon damage type of the dragon used to forge the dragonsteel.

weapons.description: The weapon deals an additional 1d6 damage of the breath weapon damage type of the dragon used to forge the dragonsteel.

name: Mithral
description: Mithral is a light, bluish metal found in the Underdark. It is favored for armor production due to its low density.

armor.limits: any armor that is not fortress plate
armor.description: The armor weighs half as much. If such armor has a Strength requirement, that requirement is removed. If such armor imposes disadvantage on Stealth checks, that disadvantage is also removed.

weapons.description: If the weapon has the Heavy property, it loses it. If the weapon does not have the Heavy or Two-Handed properties, it gains the Light property.

name: Titanium
description: This sturdy metal is among the rarest of natural metals, and it is favored for armor production.

armor.description: The armor makes you more resistant to critical hits. When an enemy rolls a critical hit with an attack roll against you, they must confirm the additional damage by rolling a d4. On a roll of 1 or 2, any additional damage from the critical hit is negated.
